title: Close Brothers Group Weekly News Summary
body:
**Fitch Affirms 'BBB' Rating with Negative Outlook**

On December 15, 2025, Fitch Ratings affirmed Close Brothers Group's (CBG) Long-Term Issuer Default Rating at 'BBB' with a Negative Outlook. The rating reflects challenges in the motor finance sector, weakened profitability, and asset quality concerns. The Negative Outlook indicates uncertainties related to the group's restructuring efforts and potential impacts from the Financial Conduct Authority's review of historical motor finance commission arrangements. ([tradingview.com](https://www.tradingview.com/news/reuters.com%2C2025-12-15%3Anewsml_FIT5N8wpd%3A0-fitch-affirms-close-brothers-group-at-bbb-outlook-negative/?utm_source=openai))

**Analyst Consensus Rating**

As of December 7, 2025, eight analysts covering Close Brothers Group have assigned an average rating of "Hold." The consensus includes five "Hold" ratings and three "Buy" ratings, with an average 12-month price target of GBX 490.63. ([marketbeat.com](https://www.marketbeat.com/instant-alerts/close-brothers-group-plc-loncbg-receives-average-rating-of-hold-from-analysts-2025-12-07/?utm_source=openai))

**Sale of Winterflood Securities**

Close Brothers Group announced the sale of its execution services and securities arm, Winterflood Securities, to Marex Group plc for £103.9 million in an all-cash deal. The transaction is expected to close in early 2026, pending regulatory approvals. This divestiture aligns with the group's strategy to streamline operations and focus on core specialist lending businesses. The sale is anticipated to enhance the group's Common Equity Tier 1 (CET1) capital ratio by approximately 30 basis points, increasing it from 14.0% to around 14.3%. ([asktraders.com](https://www.asktraders.com/analysis/close-brothers-sheds-winterflood-in-strategic-shift-bolstering-capital-and-focusing-on-core-lending/?utm_source=openai))
